classes.point:
An entity that works like env_soundscape except that it works in conjunction with trigger_soundscape to determine when a player hears it. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
If set to -1, then the player can hear the soundscape as long as he can see it (regardless of distance to it). The name of the soundscape to use. Corresponds to an entry in the soundscapes*.txt file in the hl2\scripts directory. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: requireLOS Removed: parentname, position0, position1, position2, position3, position4, position5, position6, position7, thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes

An entity to control wind in the map. Partially functional. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis. Minimum speed of the wind while idling. Maximum speed of the wind while idling. Minimum speed of wind gusts. Maximum speed of wind gusts. Minimum time delay between random gusts. Maximum time delay between random gusts. How long will the wind gust for. Maximum amount that the wind's direction changes due to a gust. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: scale Removed: thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes

An entity that defines an intermission spot where dead players will float until they respawn. ----- KEYS ----- Name of entity that dead players will face while in intermission at this spot. An entity that does nothing itself, but can be used to specify the destination for a trigger_teleport entity. An info_target can be used instead. ----- KEYS ----- This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: link_guid, scale Removed: parentname, targetname, thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes

A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics instead. ----- KEYS ----- The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis. If enabled, causes this entity/prop to to render in fast water reflections (i.e. when a water material specifies $reflectonlymarkedentities) and in the world impostor pass.
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default. The name that other entities refer to this entity by. If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'. If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'. Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons. Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under dx7, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'. The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.
The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation. If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'. If set, the prop will not use bone followers, even if it has them defined. If set, the prop will not play any sounds that are embedded in animations it plays. If set, the prop will not loop its animation, but hold the last frame. Minimum time between random animations. Maximum time between random animations.
Select a path_corner entity to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.

classes.point: An entity used to control the LOD behavior of any water in the map. If your map has water, this entity is required. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This is the distance from the camera that water will start transitioning to cheap water, in inches. This is the distance from the camera that water will finish transitioning to cheap water, in inches. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Removed: thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes
